domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

text: @AnglianWater @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency See job ref 58258445 - December 4th. Was told first time found failed pump, and second time blocked manhole. Nice new fence around the tank but still overflowing... I know it‚Äôs rained a bit, but this is not ideal :)
@picturespete @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency Oh I see, our engineers will be sure to make sure it's all sorted
@EnvAgencyNW I reported the issue via email and the local team replied with an email stating it is not their responsibility and for me to contact land registry.... UNBELIEVABLE!!!

@AnglianWater @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency That item is dated 31 October on the map... from the first time I reported this. Subsequently reported in November, December and a couple of wks back too. Some work has been done, but not stopped discharge?

@EnvAgencyNW I‚Äôve now had contact from your local team, they say it is not their responsibility as it‚Äôs not their land. Same old story, Northwich just suffered terrible floods and Agencies not working together to find answers is part of the problem @MikeAmesburyMP @NorthwichBID @NorthwichTC

@picturespete @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency Thanks Peter, so it looks like from the notification you have sent me just then from the In Your Area section, that we are currently on site working on this issue right now. - Austin
@AnglianWater @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency https://t.co/NFbfOb7S0r

RT @EnvAgencySE: The Lower Mole Flood Alleviation Scheme needs to be updated for the future. 
If you‚Äôre affected by this then we would like‚Ä¶
I think it's only right to thank the team from @EnvAgencyMids for their excellent work in #NorthNotts recently. https://t.co/YYd9iFPX0x
@AnglianWater @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency Correction: job number 58258445 refers
@picturespete @AnglianWater @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @EnvAgency This seems to be a reoccurring issue. Chalk streams deserve better. Come on Anglia Water sort out the problem.
RT @EnvAgencyYNE: We have staff at #HolmeFleet #PortClarence, working to resolve increased water levels due to a blocked culvert. Levels ar‚Ä¶

@AnglianWater @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency @AnglianWater I am told that this tank is once again overflowing as discharging (what I believe is) untreated sewage into the River Hiz chalk stream... what can be done here? Job ref 19058036 (31 October) refers

@IvelRev @KathrynMackenz6 @AffinityWater @OliverHealdUK @EnvAgency @AquiferChalk This is indeed great to see.  But to cut the abstraction rate, either water needs to be taken from somewhere else instead or we simply need to use less of it. Neither of which is that easy, sadly... Hopefully with groundwater at a long-term high, things might be ok for a bit

urls.title: How to help us count shad - Unlocking the Severn
urls.description: Help us monitor the annual shad migration by counting the number of fish successful swimming upstream at the notch in Upper Lode weir. We need the help and support of members of the public to help us monitor the rare twaite shad during their annual migration on the River Severn. So, if you have a few minutes to spare, please help us count shad and become a citizen scientist! The visual count by citizen scientists is an important part of our monitoring programme. It provides data and helps calibrate other

text:
Kids and adults you can help @severnunlocked by doing some   #citizenscience by watching some video footage of a fish pass and counting the number of fish that make it over https://t.co/HUV3J69haH

#Homeschooling @severnrivers  @LYR_Shropshire @EnvAgencyMids @CitSciAssoc https://t.co/I25L6SnvlG
